attributes.action: Stop spending road tax on other things and repair our roads eg potholes.
attributes.background: The roads in Lancashire are getting worse and the only potholes being repaired are the ones people are not constantly complaining about while others (sometimes on the same road) are just left to get worse. We want to know where are road tax is being spent if not being spent on the roads.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Road repairs, such as potholes, are the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here: http://www.lancashire.gov.uk/council/get-involved/petitions.aspx
